Author: DickCheneysTaint

Comment: C&P google results for top 5 imports from Canada/Mexico to the US.   I hardly see any of this being red state exclusive.    Canada…  Surprised that lumber wasn’t there.  Mineral Fuels and Oils: This category includes crude oil, natural gas, and petroleum products, reports Trading Economics and is the largest Canadian export to the U.S.  Vehicles: This includes cars, trucks, and other motor vehicles, as well as parts and accessories.  Machinery, Nuclear Reactors, Boilers: This category includes a wide range of machinery and equipment.  Plastics and Articles Thereof: This includes a variety of plastic products and materials.  Commodities Not Specified According to Kind: This category includes a wide range of other goods, reports Trading Economics.   And Mexico…  Honestly 3 and 4 were surprising.  1. Vehicles: This category includes cars, trucks, and other motorized vehicles, with a value of $136.97 billion in 2024.  2. Machinery: This includes machinery, nuclear reactors, and boilers, with a value of $105.83 billion in 2024.  3. Electrical and Electronic Equipment: This includes a wide range of electronic devices, with a value of $87.56 billion in 2024.  4. Optical, Photo, Technical, and Medical Apparatus: This category includes a variety of instruments and equipment, with a value of $22.92 billion in 2024.  5. Mineral Fuels and Mineral Oils: This includes oil and gas products, with a value of $25.01 billion in 2023-2024.
